title: Gezamenlijke "sent items" of "verzonden" voor pop accounts
creator: Blacktiger63
content:
Ik weet niet of je ook ergens feature requests kunt doen.

De reden dat ik nog niet overgestapt ben op Thunderbird is bovenstaande. In outlook kan ik de map "verzonden items" nemen en daar snel even tussen recent verstuurde mails bladeren. En dat is handig want ik heb veel mail accounts waarvan een aantal ook pop3 is en dat is een bewuste keuze. Daarmee heb ik namelijk ook 1 gezamenlijke inbox, zodat ik o.a. de nieuwe mail veel sneller kan nakijken.

Een globale inbox maken kan ook met Thunderbird dus dat is geen probleem.

Maar ik zie geen mogelijkheid om ook een globale "verzonden items" te maken. Gaat zoiets nog komen?

Of is er een mogelijkheid om dan zelf een map verzonden items te maken en daarin alle verzonden berichten van alle pop accounts terecht te laten komen? Liefst op zo'n manier dat ik net als bij Outlook de globale inbox en verzonden box boven in het scherm heb staan boven de accounts. Net zoals de "favorieten" bij Outlook dus.

content:
When I have an email and I want to save it as a PDF file, it saves the resulting PDF in the root directory of the drive. I would like to change this so that the it saves to the Desktop.

Here's what I'm doing: in Thunderbird (TB), I have an open email that I want to save ("Print") as a PDF. I go to the drop-down menu "More", then select "Print", then "Save to PDF". The resulting PDF is saved in the root directory of my computer's drive, which is not where I want it. I do not see any option to choose the save location for this function.

I am running Thunderbird 115.16.2 (64-bit) on an Intel Core i3 PC running Windows 7 Pro.

Thank you in advance for your help!

Mike

title: thunderbird sees momentarily but fails to download emails
creator: thunderbirder
content:
I've had 2 problems with Thunderbird for .5-1 year now. I'll make a separate post on the 'lost password' issue later. For this post, I'll focus on the failure to download emails issues.

When I do a send/receive (for all accounts), I will see for an account the name turn blue momentarily (indicating a new email), but that will disappear quickly and no email will be downloaded. When I go to webmail for that account...there is a new email in the inbox that failed to download. Further attempts to download are futile. This has happened with multiple accounts and multiple senders, and the only solution I've found is to move all the emails to local folders, delete the account, re-setup, and move the older emails back. Then it will download the email at issue (indicating to me it is not an issue with the email itself). Deleting the global-messages-db.sqlite file doesn't solve the issue. Anyone know why this is happening and how to stop or at least fix it easier than my solution?

My gut says that the email is downloading, but is getting marked wrong somehow. The emails are not in any other folders that I've detected--they're not going to straight to trash. In thunderbird, all junk settings are off. the 'global' box is unchecked, as is the box in the specific account.

As for the details, it happened today and after I updated to the latest version 128.4.2esr, but that didn't help. It would have been the prior version before updating. Win 11, 1 yr old computer with no hardware issues. The computer is generally up to date...at most a version or so behind--I don't always update IMMEDIATELY.

I have 9 accounts--5/4 Pop3/IMAP. I use the pop3 mostly and that's where the issues are (solely). Also, Thunderbird data is on a NAS on a LAN. I understand that is not preferred, but I've been doing that for a decade or more without issues (until recently). I have my own domain, and that email system uses cpanel. I've had that for years without issue...again until now. I've made no changes on the email server end-that'd be beyond me anyway. And its intermittent--fairly rare, say 1 in 500 or more emails? No encryption.

Any help would be appreciated,

Thank you
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:132.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/132.0

title: Passwords lost in Thunderbird
creator: thunderbirder
content:
I've been having this problem for probably about a year now. I have 9 accounts (5 Pop3 and 4 IMAP), and the passwords are stored by Thunderbird. I click the send/recieve button and everything downloads...until it doesn't. I go the settings/ saved passwords and what was a long list is very short...it has the MS oauth stuff for outlook.com emails and nothing else.

Over time I've found a relatively easy workaround. if I click the offline button in the lower corner, eventually it will prompt me for all the missing passwords and I'll be ok. But I have to exit and re-enter Thunderbird for that to work. If I do it in the instance after a download failure...it just hangs.

I use Firefox, and I noticed it happened one time after a Firefox update and I thought that might be an issue, but that didn't happen on the next update. There is nothing overt or obvious with my computer that would explain it...no dropped connections or errors...

I will note that I generally keep the computer and Thunderbird updated...but not necessarily immediately after the latest update is released. Thunderbird is at 128.4.2esr now. Windows 11, 1 yr old computer.

I do he the Thunderbird data on a NAS accessed over a LAN. I've been doing that for a long time with no issues.

No other changes on my end see to be the issue. Any ideas?

Thanks for any advice.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:132.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/132.0
